jx.jx_en_mean: because of or on account of

lj.lj_ly: his reading was hesitant owing to a stammer.
lj.lj_ls: 由于口吃他朗读时结结巴巴的。

entry.def: If you owe money to someone, they have lent it to you and you have not yet paid it back. You can also say that the money is owing .

example.ex: The company owes money to more than 60 banks...
example.tran: 这家公司欠下60多家银行的债。
布莱克已经欠他将近50英镑了。

entry.tran: 应把…归因（于）；应把…归功（于）
entry.def: If someone or something owes a particular quality or their success to a person or thing, they only have it because of that person or thing.

example.ex: I always suspected she owed her first job to her friendship with Roger...
example.tran: 我一直怀疑她仗着自己是罗杰的朋友才得到第一份工作。

example.ex: He owed his survival to his strength as a swimmer...
example.tran: 他是因为水性好才幸免于难的。

entry.def: If you say that you owe a great deal to someone or something, you mean that they have helped you or influenced you a lot, and you feel very grateful to them.

example.ex: As a professional composer I owe much to Radio 3...
example.tran: 作为一名职业作曲家，我十分感激第三电台。

example.ex: He's been fantastic. I owe him a lot.
example.tran: 他真是个大好人，我欠他太多了。

entry.def: If you say that something owes a great deal to a person or thing, you mean that it exists, is successful, or has its particular form mainly because of them.

example.ex: The island's present economy owes a good deal to whisky distilling...
example.tran: 该岛当前的经济发展主要归功于蒸馏法酿造威士忌酒行业。

example.ex: Mrs Allen's style of cooking owes much to her mother-in-law.
example.tran: 艾伦太太的烹饪风格很大程度上承传于她的婆婆。

entry.tran: 应该给予（某人感激、尊重、忠诚等）
entry.def: If you say that you owe someone gratitude, respect, or loyalty, you mean that they deserve it from you.

example.ex: Perhaps we owe these people more respect...
example.tran: 也许我们应该给予这些人更多的尊重。

example.ex: I owe you an apology. You must have found my attitude very annoying...
example.tran: 我应该向你道歉。你一定觉得我的态度很恶劣吧。

entry.tran: 应该为（某人做）；有必要为（某人做）
entry.def: If you say that you owe it to someone to do something, you mean that you should do that thing because they deserve it.

example.ex: I can't go. I owe it to him to stay...
example.tran: 我不能走。看在他的分上我也该留下来。

example.ex: You owe it to yourself to get some professional help...
example.tran: 你应该为了自己寻求专业人士的帮助。

entry.def: You use owing to when you are introducing the reason for something.

example.ex: He was out of work owing to a physical injury...
Owing to staff shortages, there was no restaurant car on the train.
example.tran: 由于缺人手，这趟火车上没有餐车。
